attributes.additional_details:
We don't know how many more prey animals are caught, but didn't bring home, or how many escaped but subsequently died.

Read more at https://www.rspb.org.uk/birds-and-wildlife/advice/gardening-for-wildlife/animal-deterrents/cats-and-garden-birds/are-cats-causing-bird-declines/#DGKEMh7cMZLZ14ox.99
attributes.background: The most recent figures of how many creatures are killed by cats are from the Mammal Society. They estimate that cats in the UK catch up to 275 million prey items a year, of which 55 million are birds. This is the number of prey items which were known to have been caught.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about cats killing birds and mammals, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
